Other Information.Additional Info: D2/H2 selectivity of 21.16 at 40 K and 9.12 at 77 K. T2/D2 selectivity of 2.44 at 77 K and 2.81 at 87 K.
Enrichment from 2.5% D2 to 93.04% at 77 K and 96.59% at 87 K after three cycles.
T2/D2 selectivity of 2.44 at 77 K and 2.81 at 87 K.

Sieving Mechanism: Chemical affinity quantum sieving (CAQS) effect with difference in adsorption heat of 1.8 kJ/mol between D2 and H2.

Experimental Validation.Method: Thermal desorption spectroscopy (TDS), gas adsorption isotherms, iDPC-STEM, XPS, ICP-OES, TG/DSC
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: D2/H2 selectivity: 21.16 at 40 K, 9.12 at 77 K; T2/D2 selectivity: 2.44 at 77 K, 2.81 at 87 K

Other Information.Additional Info: Ag(I)Y exhibits strong interaction with D2 and preferential adsorption of heavier isotopes due to lower zero-point energy (ZPE).
